datasets.name: 57b1e8c8
datasets.query:
--Get the latest Job information
With latest_job_info(
  select
    *
  from
    (
      SELECT
        *,
        row_number() over(
          PARTITION BY job_id
          order by
            change_time desc
        ) as row
      FROM
        system.workflow.jobs
    ) job_info
  where
    row = 1
),
--SKu price
latest_sku_price(
  select
    *
  from
    (
      select
        sku_name,
        cloud,
        currency_code,
        pricing.effective_list.default as list_price,
        price_start_time,
        COALESCE(price_end_time, NOW()) AS price_end_time
      from
        system.billing.list_prices
    ) latest_price
),
--billinginfo
billing_usage_detail (
  select
    *,
    usage_metadata.cluster_id,
    usage_metadata.job_id,
    usage_metadata.job_run_id,
    identity_metadata.run_as as owner,
    TRANSFORM(
      MAP_KEYS(custom_tags),
      (k, i) -> CONCAT(
        lower(k),
        '=',
        lower(MAP_VALUES(custom_tags) [i])
      )
    ) AS key_value_tags
  from
    system.billing.usage
  where
    usage_metadata.job_id is not null
    and usage_metadata.job_run_id is not null
    and usage_date BETWEEN :start_date
    AND :end_date
    AND (
      :tags = 'All'
      OR array_contains(
        TRANSFORM(
          MAP_KEYS(custom_tags),
          (k, i) -> CONCAT(
            lower(k),
            '=',
            lower(MAP_VALUES(custom_tags) [i])
          )
        ),
        :tags
      )
    )
),
--billing per sku price
billing_sku_detail (
  select
    u.*,
    p.currency_code,
    list_price,
    c.name as job_name,
    (coalesce(usage_quantity, 0) * list_price) as Dollar_Amount
  from
    billing_usage_detail u
    inner join latest_job_info c on u.job_id = c.job_id
    inner join latest_sku_price p on u.sku_name = p.sku_name
    and u.cloud = p.cloud
    and usage_date BETWEEN :start_date
    AND :end_date
    and u.usage_start_time BETWEEN p.price_start_time
    AND p.price_end_time
),
--Job run duration
/*job_run_duration_1 as (
    SELECT workspace_id,
        job_id,
        run_id,
        min(period_start_time) as period_start_time,
        max(period_end_time) as period_end_time,
        CAST(SUM(period_end_time - period_start_time) AS LONG) / 3600 as duration,
        FIRST(result_state, TRUE) as result_state
    FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline jr where
    jr.period_start_time BETWEEN :start_date AND :end_date
    GROUP BY ALL
    ORDER BY period_start_time DESC
),*/
job_run_duration as (
  select
    b.workspace_id,
    b.job_id,
    b.run_id,
    b.period_start_time,
    b.period_end_time,
    (
      UNIX_TIMESTAMP(period_end_time) - UNIX_TIMESTAMP(period_start_time)
    ) / 3600 AS duration,
    b.result_state,
    run_type,
    termination_code
  from
    system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline b --inner join job_run_duration_1 b on a.job_id=b.job_id and a.run_id=b.run_id and  a.period_end_time=b.period_end_time
  WHERE
    period_start_time BETWEEN :start_date
    AND :end_date
),
--Job run duration and cost
billing_sku_detail_duration (
  select
    jrc.*,
    jrt.period_start_time,
    jrt.period_end_time,
    result_state,
    duration,
    run_type,
    termination_code,
    job_name
  from
    billing_sku_detail jrc
    inner join job_run_duration jrt on jrc.job_run_id = jrt.run_id
    and jrc.job_id = jrt.job_id
    and jrt.workspace_id = jrc.workspace_id --and jrt.period_start_time between jrc.usage_start_time and jrc.usage_end_time
    and (
      date(jrt.period_start_time) = jrc.usage_date
      or date(jrt.period_end_time) = jrc.usage_date
    )
),
--latest cluster detail
clusters AS (
  SELECT
    *,
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER(
      PARTITION BY workspace_id,
      cluster_id
      ORDER BY
        change_time DESC
    ) as rn
  FROM
    system.compute.clusters QUALIFY rn = 1
),
details (
  select
    b.*,
    cluster_source,
    cluster_name,
    owned_by as cluster_owned_by,
    dbr_version,
    case
      when result_state = 'TIMED_OUT' then 'Timeout_set'
      else 'Timeout_Notset'
    end as Timeout_flag --and run_type = 'JOB_RUN' and termination_code = 'CANCELLED' then 'Timeout_set' else 'Timeout_Notset' end as Timeout_flag
  from
    billing_sku_detail_duration b
    left join clusters c USING (workspace_id, cluster_id)
),
top_k_jobs as (
  SELECT
    job_name,
    sum(Dollar_Amount) as Dollar_Amount
  FROM
    details
  GROUP BY
    job_name
  ORDER BY
    Dollar_Amount DESC
  LIMIT
    :top_k
), top_k_owners as (
  SELECT
    owner,
    sum(Dollar_Amount) as Dollar_Amount
  FROM
    details
  GROUP BY
    owner
  ORDER BY
    Dollar_Amount DESC
  LIMIT
    :top_k
)
select
  *,
  CASE
    WHEN cluster_source IN (
      'UI', 'API'
    ) THEN 'All PURPOSE CLUSTER'
    WHEN cluster_source is null
    THEN 'SERVERLESS'
    ELSE cluster_source
  END AS cleansed_cluster_source,
  CASE
    WHEN job_name IN (
      SELECT
        job_name
      FROM
        top_k_jobs
    ) THEN job_name
    ELSE 'All Others'
  END AS cleansed_job_name,
  CASE
    WHEN owner IN (
      SELECT
        owner
      FROM
        top_k_owners
    ) THEN owner
    ELSE 'All Others'
  END AS cleansed_owner
  -- ,CASE
  --   WHEN owner LIKE '%@%' THEN 'non_service_principal'
  --   ELSE 'service_principal'
  -- END AS owner_type
FROM
  details

datasets.name: f4226adb
datasets.query:
with jobs as (
    select account_id, workspace_id, job_id, name
    from (
            SELECT account_id, workspace_id, job_id, name,
                row_number() over(
                    PARTITION BY job_id
                    order by change_time desc
                ) as row
            FROM system.workflow.jobs
        ) job_info
    where row = 1
), 

-- job results
job_results as (
 SELECT period_start_time as usage_date, 
    --date(period_start_time) as usage_date,
    job_id,
    result_state,
    count(*) as total
  FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
  WHERE
    --period_start_time > current_date() - interval 90 days -- yatish
    --AND 
    result_state in ('ERROR', 'TIMED_OUT', 'SUCCEEDED', 'FAILED','CANCELLED','SKIPPED')
  GROUP BY
    period_start_time,
    job_id,
    result_state
), job_results_agg as (
  SELECT
  usage_date,
  job_id,
  coalesce(ERROR, 0) as total_error,
  coalesce(TIMED_OUT, 0) as total_timed_out,
  coalesce(SUCCEEDED, 0) as total_succeeded,
  coalesce(FAILED, 0) as total_failed,
  coalesce(CANCELLED, 0) as total_cancelled,
  coalesce(SKIPPED, 0) as total_skipped,
  (coalesce(ERROR, 0) + coalesce(TIMED_OUT, 0) + coalesce(SUCCEEDED, 0) + coalesce(FAILED, 0)+ coalesce(CANCELLED, 0)+ (coalesce(SKIPPED, 0))) as total_runs,
  round(((coalesce(ERROR, 0) + coalesce(TIMED_OUT, 0) + coalesce(FAILED, 0))/(coalesce(ERROR, 0) + coalesce(TIMED_OUT, 0) + coalesce(FAILED, 0) + coalesce(SUCCEEDED, 0))),2) as failure_rate
FROM (
  SELECT
    usage_date,
    job_id,
    result_state,
    total
    from job_results
)
PIVOT (
  sum(total)
  FOR result_state IN ('ERROR', 'TIMED_OUT', 'SUCCEEDED', 'FAILED','CANCELLED','SKIPPED')
)
),
latest_job_info(
select job_id , max(usage_date) as latest_usage_dt,sum(total_runs) as total_runs ,sum(total_error) as total_error ,sum(total_timed_out) as total_timed_out
,sum(total_succeeded) as total_succeeded,sum(total_failed) as total_failed, sum(total_cancelled) as total_cancelled,
round((sum(total_error)+sum(total_timed_out)+sum(total_failed)+ sum(total_cancelled)+sum(total_skipped))/sum(total_runs),2)*100  as failure_rate from job_results_agg group by 1 
  
),
--select *from latest_job_info where job_id='301190336755832'

--select * from system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline where job_id='301190336755832' order by 5 desc 

-- latest 
job_runs as( select job_id, usage_date,job_duration_sec/60 as duration_min,round(((job_duration_sec-previous_duration)/abs(previous_duration))*100,2) as job_duration_pct_change,result_state from (SELECT 
    period_start_time AS usage_date,result_state,
    -- Calculate job_duration_sec outside the window function
    timediff(SECOND, period_start_time, period_end_time) AS job_duration_sec,
    job_id,
    -- Use the calculated job_duration_sec directly without referencing it as a lateral column alias
    LEAD(timediff(SECOND, period_start_time, period_end_time)) OVER (PARTITION BY job_id ORDER BY period_start_time DESC) AS previous_duration,
    row_number() OVER (PARTITION BY job_id ORDER BY period_start_time DESC) AS row
  FROM system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline
) where row =1
)
--select *from job_runs where job_id='301190336755832'


/*average_duration as(
select job_id, avg(job_duration_sec)/60 as avg_job_duration_min from job_runs where result_state = 'SUCCEEDED' group by job_id
),


latest_run as (
  select job_id, result_state as latest_result, job_duration_sec/60 as latest_duration_min from job_runs where row = 1
)*/


select date(ragg.latest_usage_dt)as latest_usage_dt ,
  j.account_id,
  j.workspace_id,
  j.job_id,
  j.name,
  lr.result_state,
  lr.duration_min as latest_duration_min,
  ragg.total_runs,
  ragg.total_error,
  ragg.total_timed_out,
  ragg.total_succeeded,
  ragg.total_failed,
  ragg.total_cancelled,
  ragg.failure_rate,
  job_duration_pct_change
  --round((lr.latest_duration_min-ad.avg_job_duration_min)/abs(ad.avg_job_duration_min)*100,2) as pct_job_duration_change
from jobs j
inner join job_runs lr
  on j.job_id = lr.job_id
inner join latest_job_info ragg
  on j.job_id = ragg.job_id

order by 1 desc

datasets.name: 4e2dddd3
datasets.query:
WITH jobs AS (
  SELECT
    account_id,
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    name AS job_name
  FROM
    (
      SELECT
        account_id,
        workspace_id,
        job_id,
        name,
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY job_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) AS row
      FROM
        system.lakeflow.jobs
    ) job_info
  WHERE
    row = 1
),
job_runs AS (
  SELECT
    j.account_id,
    j.workspace_id,
    j.job_id,
    j.job_name,
    jrt.run_id AS job_run_id,
    jrt.period_start_time,
    jrt.period_end_time,
    jrt.run_type,
    jrt.trigger_type,
    jrt.termination_code
  FROM
    jobs j INNER JOIN system.lakeflow.job_run_timeline jrt
  WHERE
    j.job_id = jrt.job_id
    and period_start_time BETWEEN :start_date AND :end_date --AND jrt.period_start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 90 DAYS
),
job_run_tasks AS (
  SELECT
    jr.account_id,
    jr.workspace_id,
    jr.job_id,
    jr.job_name,
    jr.job_run_id,
    jr.period_start_time AS run_start_time,
    jr.period_end_time AS run_end_time,
    jr.run_type,
    jr.trigger_type,
    jr.termination_code AS run_termination_code,
    jtr.run_id AS job_task_run_id,
    jtr.parent_run_id,
    jtr.period_start_time AS task_start_time,
    jtr.period_end_time AS task_end_time,
    jtr.task_key,
    EXPLODE(jtr.compute_ids) cluster_id,
    jtr.result_state AS task_result_state,
    jtr.termination_code AS task_termination_code
  FROM
    job_runs jr INNER JOIN system.lakeflow.job_task_run_timeline jtr
  WHERE
    jr.job_run_id = jtr.job_run_id
    and jtr.period_start_time BETWEEN :start_date AND :end_date -- AND jtr.period_start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 90 DAYS
),
clusters AS (
  SELECT
    cluster_name,
    cluster_id,
    owned_by,
    driver_node_type,
    worker_node_type,
    worker_count,
    min_autoscale_workers,
    max_autoscale_workers,
    auto_termination_minutes,
    dbr_version
  FROM
    (
      SELECT
        *,
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY cluster_id ORDER BY change_time DESC) AS row
      FROM
        system.compute.clusters
    )
  WHERE
    row = 1
),
node_type_details as (
  select
    node_type,
    core_count,
    memory_mb / 1000 as memory_gb,
    gpu_count
  from
    system.compute.node_types
),
clusters_extended as (
  select
    c.*,
    ntdriver.core_count as driver_core_count,
    ntdriver.memory_gb as driver_memory_gb,
    ntdriver.gpu_count as driver_gpu_count,
    ntworker.core_count as worker_core_count,
    ntworker.memory_gb as worker_memory_gb,
    ntworker.gpu_count as worker_gpu_count
  from
    clusters c
      inner join node_type_details ntdriver
        on ntdriver.node_type = c.driver_node_type
      inner join node_type_details ntworker
        on ntworker.node_type = c.worker_node_type
),
job_clusters_timeline AS (
  SELECT
    jrt.account_id,
    jrt.workspace_id,
    jrt.job_id,
    jrt.job_name,
    jrt.job_run_id,
    jrt.run_start_time,
    jrt.run_end_time,
    jrt.run_type,
    jrt.trigger_type,
    jrt.run_termination_code,
    jrt.job_task_run_id,
    jrt.parent_run_id,
    jrt.task_start_time,
    jrt.task_end_time,
    jrt.task_key,
    jrt.task_result_state,
    jrt.task_termination_code,
    c.cluster_name,
    c.cluster_id,
    c.owned_by,
    c.driver_node_type,
    c.driver_core_count,
    c.driver_memory_gb,
    c.driver_gpu_count,
    c.worker_node_type,
    c.worker_core_count,
    c.worker_memory_gb,
    c.worker_gpu_count,
    c.worker_count,
    c.min_autoscale_workers,
    c.max_autoscale_workers,
    c.auto_termination_minutes,
    c.dbr_version,
    nt.instance_id,
    nt.start_time AS instance_start_time,
    nt.end_time AS instance_end_time,
    nt.driver,
    nt.cpu_user_percent,
    nt.cpu_system_percent,
    nt.cpu_wait_percent,
    nt.mem_used_percent,
    nt.mem_swap_percent,
    nt.network_sent_bytes,
    nt.network_received_bytes
  FROM
    job_run_tasks jrt
      INNER JOIN clusters_extended c
        ON jrt.cluster_id = c.cluster_id
      INNER JOIN system.compute.node_timeline nt
  WHERE
    jrt.cluster_id = nt.cluster_id
    AND nt.start_time >= jrt.task_start_time
    AND nt.end_time <= jrt.task_end_time
    and nt.start_time BETWEEN :start_date AND :end_date --AND nt.start_time >= CURRENT_DATE() - INTERVAL 90 DAYS
), --SELECT * FROM job_clusters_timeline
top_k_low_cpu AS (
  select
    account_id,
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    job_name,
    avg(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) as `Avg CPU Utilization`
  from
    job_clusters_timeline
  group by
    account_id,
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    job_name
  ORDER BY
    `Avg CPU Utilization` asc
  LIMIT :top_k
),
top_k_high_cpu AS (
  select
    account_id,
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    job_name,
    avg(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent) as `Avg CPU Utilization`
  from
    job_clusters_timeline
  group by
    account_id,
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    job_name
  ORDER BY
    `Avg CPU Utilization` desc
  LIMIT :top_k
),
top_k_high_mem AS (
  select
    account_id,
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    job_name,
    avg(mem_used_percent) as `Avg Memory Utilization`
  from
    job_clusters_timeline
  group by
    account_id,
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    job_name
  ORDER BY
    `Avg Memory Utilization` desc
  LIMIT :top_k
),
top_k_low_mem AS (
  select
    account_id,
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    job_name,
    avg(mem_used_percent) as `Avg Memory Utilization`
  from
    job_clusters_timeline
  group by
    account_id,
    workspace_id,
    job_id,
    job_name
  ORDER BY
    `Avg Memory Utilization` asc
  LIMIT :top_k
)
select
  *,
  round(cpu_user_percent + cpu_system_percent, 2) as cpu_total_percent,
  network_sent_bytes / (1024 * 1024) as bytes_sent,
  network_received_bytes / (1024 * 1024) as bytes_rec,
  CASE
    WHEN
      job_name IN (
        SELECT
          job_name
        FROM
          top_k_low_cpu
      )
    THEN
      'LOW CPU'
    ELSE null
  END AS top_k_low_cpu_job,
  CASE
    WHEN
      job_name IN (
        SELECT
          job_name
        FROM
          top_k_high_cpu
      )
    THEN
      'High CPU'
    ELSE null
  END AS top_k_high_cpu_job,
  CASE
    WHEN
      job_name IN (
        SELECT
          job_name
        FROM
          top_k_high_mem
      )
    THEN
      'HIGH MEMORY'
    ELSE null
  END AS top_k_high_mem_job,
  CASE
    WHEN
      job_name IN (
        SELECT
          job_name
        FROM
          top_k_low_mem
      )
    THEN
      'LOW MEMORY'
    ELSE null
  END AS top_k_low_mem_job,
  row_number() OVER(PARTITION BY job_run_id, 
  instance_start_time, instance_end_time, trigger_type, 
  run_termination_code, cluster_id, driver_node_type, worker_node_type, 
  worker_count, cpu_user_percent, mem_used_percent ORDER BY job_task_run_id) AS row_num_for_table
from
  job_clusters_timeline
-- where job_run_id = '1002919912225130'
;

/* Removed by Jake 11/25 with Yatish
select distinct Job_id , owned_by, Job_name , job_run_id , run_start_time , run_end_time , trigger_type , run_termination_code , cluster_id , driver_node_type , worker_node_type , worker_count, DBR_version , Avg(CPU_Total_Percent) as cpu_total_percent ,
Avg(mem_used_percent) as mem_used_percent , AVG(bytes_sent) as bytes_sent , AVG(bytes_rec) as bytes_rec

from final 
group by all 
*/

widget.name: f88c7007
widget.textbox_spec:
## Job Cost Metrics
This Section highlights the Account level $DBU trend over a period of time. Use this section to analyze: 
1. Total Cost divvied by WorkspaceId - Analyze the most expensive Workspace
2. Daily Cost Per SKU  - Analyze which SKU is costing you the most amount of $$  
3. Top Cost Per Job Owner  - Analyze the most expensive jobs in the account divvied by job owner
4. Top Cost Per Job Name - Analyze the most expensive jobs in the account divvied by job name
5. Top Cost Per DBR Version -  Analyze the cost attributed to the DBR version

# WorkFlow Advisor Dashboard

#### Section 1 - Job Cost Metrics - See which workflow(s) costs more


#### Section 2- Daily Job Run KPIs - Check details at a Job level


#### Section 3 - Latest Job Runs - Drill further into the specific run of a job

widget.name: d9563136
widget.textbox_spec:
### Visuals for CPU Utilization, Memory Utilization, and Network Traffic
* Across all jobs in this time period
